panel.generate-thumbnails-subtitle: Generate large, small and blurred thumbnails for each asset, as well as thumbnails for each person
panel.extract-metadata-subtitle: Extract metadata information from each asset, such as GPS and resolution
panel.sidecar-subtitle: Discover or synchronize sidecar metadata from the filesystem
panel.smart-search-subtitle: Run machine learning on assets to support smart search
panel.face-detection-subtitle: Detect the faces in assets using machine learning. For videos, only the thumbnail is considered. 'All' (re-)processes all assets. 'Missing' queues assets that haven't been processed yet. Detected faces will be queued for Facial Recognition after Face Detection is complete, grouping them into existing or new people.
panel.facial-recognition-subtitle: Group detected faces into people. This step runs after Face Detection is complete. 'All' (re-)clusters all faces. 'Missing' queues faces that don't have a person assigned.
panel.video-conversion-subtitle: Transcode videos for wider compatibility with browsers and devices
panel.migration-subtitle: Migrate thumbnails for assets and faces to the latest folder structure
panel.confirm-prompt: Are you sure you want to reprocess all faces? This will also clear named people.

ffmpeg.doc: To learn more about the terminology used here, refer to FFmpeg documentation for
ffmpeg.crf-desc: Video quality level. Typical values are 23 for H.264, 28 for HEVC, and 31 for VP9. Lower is better, but takes longer to encode and produces larger files.
ffmpeg.preset-desc: Compression speed. Slower presets produce smaller files, and increase quality when targeting a certain bitrate. VP9 ignores speeds above `faster`.
ffmpeg.acodec-desc: Opus is the highest quality option, but has lower compatibility with old devices or software.
ffmpeg.audioCodecs-desc: Select which audio codecs do not need to be transcoded. Only used for certain transcode policies.
ffmpeg.vcodec-desc: VP9 has high efficiency and web compatibSelect which video codecs do not need to be transcoded. Only used for certain transcode policies.ility, but takes longer to transcode. HEVC performs similarly, but has lower web compatibility. H.264 is widely compatible and quick to transcode, but produces much larger files.
ffmpeg.videoCodecs-desc: Select which video codecs do not need to be transcoded. Only used for certain transcode policies.
ffmpeg.resolution-desc: Higher resolutions can preserve more detail but take longer to encode, have larger file sizes, and can reduce app responsiveness.
ffmpeg.bitrate-desc: Setting a max bitrate can make file sizes more predictable at a minor cost to quality. At 720p, typical values are 2600k for VP9 or HEVC, or 4500k for H.264. Disabled if set to 0.
ffmpeg.threads-desc: Higher values lead to faster encoding, but leave less room for the server to process other tasks while active. This value should not be more than the number of CPU cores. Maximizes utilization if set to 0.
ffmpeg.transcode-desc: Policy for when a video should be transcoded. HDR videos will always be transcoded (except if transcoding is disabled).
ffmpeg.transcode-options-optimal: Videos higher than target resolution or not in an accepted format
ffmpeg.transcode-options-bitrate: Videos higher than max bitrate or not in an accepted format
ffmpeg.transcode-options-required: Only videos not in an accepted format
ffmpeg.transcode-options-disabled: Don't transcode any videos, may break playback on some clients
ffmpeg.tonemap-desc: Attempts to preserve the appearance of HDR videos when converted to SDR. Each algorithm makes different tradeoffs for color, detail and brightness. Hable preserves detail, Mobius preserves color, and Reinhard preserves brightness.
ffmpeg.twoPass-subtitle: Transcode in two passes to produce better encoded videos. When max bitrate is enabled (required for it to work with H.264 and HEVC), this mode uses a bitrate range based on the max bitrate and ignores CRF. For VP9, CRF can be used if max bitrate is disabled.
ffmpeg.hardware-subtitle: TrExperimental; much faster, but will have lower quality at the same bitrate
ffmpeg.hardware-accel-desc: The API that will interact with your device to accelerate transcoding. This setting is 'best effort': it will fallback to software transcoding on failure. VP9 may or may not work depending on your hardware.
ffmpeg.hardware-accel-options-Qsv: Quick Sync (requires 7th gen Intel CPU or later)
ffmpeg.hardware-cqmode-desc: ICQ is better than CQP, but some hardware acceleration devices do not support this mode. Setting this option will prefer the specified mode when using quality-based encoding. Ignored by NVENC as it does not support ICQ.
ffmpeg.hardware-temporal-aq-desc: Applies only to NVENC. Increases quality of high-detail, low-motion scenes. May not be compatible with older devices.
ffmpeg.hardware-preferred-hw-device-desc: Applies only to VAAPI and QSV. Sets the dri node used for hardware transcoding.
ffmpeg.advanced-subtitle: Options most users should not need to change
ffmpeg.advanced-nlp-desc: Colors will be adjusted to look normal for a display of this brightness. Counter-intuitively, lower values increase the brightness of the video and vice versa since it compensates for the brightness of the display. 0 sets this value automatically.
ffmpeg.advanced-bframes-desc: Higher values improve compression efficiency, but slow down encoding. May not be compatible with hardware acceleration on older devices. 0 disables B-frames, while -1 sets this value automatically.
ffmpeg.advanced-refs-desc: The number of frames to reference when compressing a given frame. Higher values improve compression efficiency, but slow down encoding. 0 sets this value automatically.
ffmpeg.advanced-gop-size-desc: Sets the maximum frame distance between keyframes. Lower values worsen compression efficiency, but improve seek times and may improve quality in scenes with fast movement. 0 sets this value automatically.

image.thumbnail-format-desc: WebP produces smaller files than JPEG, but is slower to encode.
image.thumbnail-size-desc: Used when viewing groups of photos (main timeline, album view, etc.). Higher resolutions can preserve more detail but take longer to encode, have larger file sizes, and can reduce app responsiveness.
image.preview-format-desc: WebP produces smaller files than JPEG, but is slower to encode.
image.preview-size-desc: Used when viewing a single photo and for machine learning. Higher resolutions can preserve more detail but take longer to encode, have larger file sizes, and can reduce app responsiveness.
image.quality-desc: Image quality from 1-100. Higher is better for quality but produces larger files.
image.colorspace-desc: Use Display P3 for thumbnails. This better preserves the vibrance of images with wide colorspaces, but images may appear differently on old devices with an old browser version. sRGB images are kept as sRGB to avoid color shifts.

library.watching-filesystem-subtitle: Watch external libraries for file changes
library.scanning-expression-input-desc: Set the scanning interval using the cron format. For more information please refer to e.g.

logging.level-desc: When enabled, what log level to use.

machine-learning.enable-subtitle: If disabled, all ML features will be disabled regardless of the below settings.
machine-learning.url-desc: URL of the machine learning server
machine-learning.smart-subtitle: Search for images semantically using CLIP embeddings
machine-learning.enable-clip-subtitle: If disabled, images will not be encoded for smart search.
machine-learning.clip-model-desc: The name of a CLIP model listed here. Note that you must re-run the 'Smart Search' job for all images upon changing a model.
machine-learning.facial-subtitle: Detect, recognize and group faces in images
machine-learning.facial-enable-subtitle: If disabled, images will not be encoded for facial recognition and will not populate the People section in the Explore page.
machine-learning.facial-model-desc: Models are listed in descending order of size. Larger models are slower and use more memory, but produce better results. Note that you must re-run the Face Detection job for all images upon changing a model.
machine-learning.facial-min-score-desc: Minimum confidence score for a face to be detected from 0-1. Lower values will detect more faces but may result in false positives.
machine-learning.facial-max-distance-desc: Maximum distance between two faces to be considered the same person, ranging from 0-2. Lowering this can prevent labeling two people as the same person, while raising it can prevent labeling the same person as two different people. Note that it is easier to merge two people than to split one person in two, so err on the side of a lower threshold when possible.
machine-learning.facial-min-faces-desc: The minimum number of recognized faces for a person to be created. Increasing this makes Facial Recognition more precise at the cost of increasing the chance that a face is not assigned to a person.

map.title: Map Settings
map.subtitle: Manage map settings
map.Style desc: URL to a style.json map theme

new-version-check.subtitle: Enable periodic requests to GitHub to check for new releases

oauth.details: For more details about this feature, refer to the docs
oauth.subtitle: Login with OAuth
oauth.storage-label-claim-desc: Automatically set the user's storage label to the value of this claim.
oauth.storage-quota-claim-desc: Automatically set the user's storage quota to the value of this claim.
oauth.default-storage-quota-desc: Quota in GiB to be used when no claim is provided (Enter 0 for unlimited quota).
oauth.auto-register-subtitle: Automatically register new users after signing in with OAuth
oauth.auto-launch-subtitle: Start the OAuth login flow automatically upon navigating to the login page
oauth.mobile-redirect-uri-enable-subtitle: Enable when 'app.immich:/' is an invalid redirect URI.

server.external-domain-desc: Domain for public shared links, including http(s)://
server.login-page-message-desc: A message that is displayed on the login page.

storage.template-details: For more details about this feature, refer to the docs
storage.template-hash-verification-subtitle: Enables hash verification, don't disable this unless you're certain of the implications
storage.datetime-format-desc1: Asset's creation timestamp is used for the datetime information

theme.label: Custom CSS
theme.desc: Cascading Style Sheets allow the design of Immich to be customized.

trash.days-subtitle: Number of days to keep the assets in trash before permanently removing them

user.delete-delay-desc: Number of days after removal to permanently delete a user's account and assets. The user deletion job runs at midnight to check for users that are ready for deletion. Changes to this setting will be evaluated at the next execution.

delete.force: 's account and assets will be queued for permanent deletion
delete.delayed: 's account and assets will be scheduled for permanent deletion in
delete.warning: WARNING: This will immediately remove the user and all assets. This cannot be undone and the files cannot be recovered.
